**Reported By:** [Your name]  
**Reported Date:** [Date and time]

**Severity:** [Critical / High / Medium / Low]  
**Priority:** [P1 / P2 / P3 / P4]  
**Component/Module:** [e.g., Authentication, User Management]  
**Version/Build:** [e.g., v2.1.0, Build 1234]

## Description

[Clear, detailed description of the issue]

**Example:**
When attempting to log in with valid credentials, the application displays an error message "Invalid credentials" even though the credentials are correct. This prevents users from accessing the application.

## Steps to Reproduce

[Numbered, detailed steps - should be reproducible by anyone]

1. Navigate to https://app.example.com/login
2. Enter email: "testuser@example.com"
3. Enter password: "Password123!"
4. Click "Login" button
5. Observe the error message

**Reproducibility:** [Always / Sometimes / Rarely / Unable to reproduce]

## Expected Result

[What should happen]

**Example:**
User should be successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard page with a welcome message.

## Actual Result

[What actually happens]

**Example:**
Error message "Invalid credentials" is displayed in red below the login form, and user remains on the login page. No redirect occurs.

## Example: Complete Bug Report

**Bug ID:** BUG-456  
**Title:** Login fails with valid credentials - "Invalid credentials" error displayed  
**Reported By:** John Doe  
**Reported Date:** 2024-01-15 14:30  
**Status:** New  
**Severity:** High  
**Priority:** P1  
**Component/Module:** Authentication  
**Version/Build:** v2.1.0, Build 1234

**Description:**
When users attempt to log in with valid credentials, the application incorrectly displays an "Invalid credentials" error message and prevents login. This affects all users trying to access the application.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open browser and navigate to https://test-app.example.com/login
2. Enter email address: "testuser@example.com"
3. Enter password: "Password123!"
4. Click the "Login" button
5. Observe the error message "Invalid credentials" appears below the form

**Reproducibility:** Always (100%)

**Expected Result:**
User should be successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard page (/dashboard) with a personalized welcome message.

**Actual Result:**
Red error message "Invalid credentials" is displayed below the login form. User remains on the login page (/login). No redirect occurs. Browser console shows 401 Unauthorized response from API.

**Environment:**
- Application URL: https://test-app.example.com
- Browser: Chrome 120.0.6099.109
- OS: Windows 10 Pro (Build 19045)
- Screen Resolution: 1920x1080
- Device: Desktop

**Attachments:**
- Screenshot: login-error.png (shows error message)
- Console log: console-errors.txt
- Network log: network-request.json

**Console Errors:**
```
POST https://api.example.com/auth/login 401 (Unauthorized)
Error: Authentication failed
    at AuthService.login (auth.service.ts:45)
```

**Network Request:**
```
Request URL: https://api.example.com/auth/login
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 401 Unauthorized
Request Body: {"email":"testuser@example.com","password":"Password123!"}
Response: {"error":"Invalid credentials"}
```

**Impact:**
- **Affected Users:** All users attempting to log in
- **Business Impact:** High - Blocks all user access
- **Frequency:** 100% of login attempts with valid credentials

**Related Items:**
- User Story: US-101 (User Login)
- Test Case: TC-AUTH-001 (Login with valid credentials)

**Assignee:** [To be assigned]

---

## Severity and Priority Guidelines

### Severity Levels

**Critical:**
- System crash or data loss
- Security vulnerability
- Complete feature failure blocking all users
- Example: Application crashes on startup, SQL injection vulnerability

**High:**
- Major feature broken, workaround exists
- Significant functionality not working
- Affects many users
- Example: Login doesn't work, payment processing fails

**Medium:**
- Feature partially broken
- Minor functionality issue
- Affects some users
- Example: Search returns incorrect results, form validation missing

**Low:**
- Cosmetic issue
- Minor inconvenience
- Typo or UI alignment
- Example: Button color incorrect, spelling mistake

### Priority Levels

**P1 (Critical Priority):**
- Fix immediately (same day)
- Blocks release or critical functionality
- Example: Production bug affecting all users

**P2 (High Priority):**
- Fix in current sprint
- Important but not blocking
- Example: Feature broken in test environment

**P3 (Medium Priority):**
- Fix in next sprint
- Can wait but should be fixed
- Example: Minor feature issue

**P4 (Low Priority):**
- Fix when time permits
- Nice to have
- Example: UI improvement, documentation update
